articles.body-intro:

Antiques, Fashion and Collectables Expert, [Tracy Martin|https://www.rareburg.com/user/tracym] and Antiques Expert and TV regular, [Eric Knowles|https://www.rareburg.com/user/ericknowles] to launch [free online appraisals|https://www.rareburg.com/free-appraisals] for curious treasure hunters.

We've just launched ['Appraisals'|https://www.rareburg.com/appraisal], free functionality that encourages knowledgeable collectors and experts to value items online.

articles.title: Judge Death
articles.body-snippet: If you're more into cocktails than wine, you'll be pleased to know that the demand for antique spirits has skyrocketed o
articles.body-intro:
If you're more into cocktails than wine, you'll be pleased to know that the demand for antique spirits has skyrocketed over the last few years, and there's an increasing number of them available to buy at auction.

The craze spiked in popularity in 2012, after world-class mixologist Salvatore Calabrese famously broke the Guinness World Record for the most expensive cocktail, creating a �5,500 drink at London's The Playboy Club made from 18th century cognac and Kummel liqueur, 19th century orange curacao and early 20th century bitters.

These might be somewhat specialist (and unachievable!) bot

articles.title: Art Deco Mirrors: Let There Be Light
articles.body-snippet: Visitors to my house could be forgiven for thinking it is inhabited by the nation's vainest family. That's because much
articles.body-intro:
Visitors to my house could be forgiven for thinking it is inhabited by the nation's vainest family. That's because much of the available wall space is hung with mirrors: in the entrance hall, up the stairs, on the landing, in the downstairs reception rooms and even in the cloakroom. At the last count we had eighteen of them on display with another couple tucked away in storage, awaiting their chance to shine.

![Art Deco Mirror](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/furniture/1.jpg "Art Deco Mirror")
But these mirrors aren't there for narcissistic reasons. They have overrun the house simply be

articles.title: An Introduction to British Comic Fanzines
articles.body-snippet: Most people define a fanzine as being an amateur publication created by 'fans' or 'fandom' (thus the term) rather than p
articles.body-intro:
Most people define a fanzine as being an amateur publication created by 'fans' or 'fandom' (thus the term) rather than paid professionals. However, as with all hobbies definitions can be blurred and in this context I also include self-published comics & strip-zines ('small press'), industry journals, convention booklets and related ephemera. Two major commonalities of these publications is that the vast majority have extremely small print runs and are published 'not for profit'.

### My Background

![British Comic Fanzines](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/fanzines/fanzines.jpg "British C

articles.title: 1960s Fashion ? The Paper Dress
articles.body-snippet: Revolutionary designs and ground breaking styles emerged onto the fashion scene in the 1960s with the mini-skirt, a-line
articles.body-intro:
Revolutionary designs and ground breaking styles emerged onto the fashion scene in the 1960s with the mini-skirt, a-line shapes, baby doll, trouser suits, colourful tights and go-go boots all taking centre stage. Adopted by the new youth generations who wanted to break free from the constricting traditional dress of previous decades; this eclectic mix of styles were inspired by music, art and social scenes as a means of expressing individuality and freedom of choice through fashion.

![60s Paper Dresses](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/vintagefashion/1.jpg "60s Paper Dresses")
An abundan

articles.title: Coin Collecting, The Growing Passion
articles.body-snippet: My earliest memory of collecting coins is probably my fondest, my grandmother showed me a Victorian coin which had been
articles.body-intro:
My earliest memory of collecting coins is probably my fondest, my grandmother showed me a Victorian coin which had been passed through generations - it fascinated me. I held it in my hand wondering who else had been doing the same over one hundred years before me, perhaps even a twelve year old boy, like myself at the time.

![Charles I coin dated 1643](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/coins/1.1.jpg "Charles I coin dated 1643") 
An experience like this often starts the 'Schoolboy Collection', often coins or stamps. The true collector is somebody who carries on their collecting through chi

articles.title: How To Spot Counterfeit Wines
articles.body-snippet: The business of buying fine wine at auction can be a daunting one, particularly when it comes to ensuring the wine you?r
articles.body-intro:
The business of buying fine wine at auction can be a daunting one, particularly when it comes to ensuring the wine you?re buying is what it says it is.

Counterfeit wine is far from a new problem: the Romans worried about it, Chaucer warned about it in his Canterbury Tales ? and those odd nets you see over bottles of inexpensive Spanish wine? They?re a nod to an anti-counterfeiting technique from the early 20th century, when bottles used to be re-filled or have their labels switched.

Over the years, wine fraud has become more sophisticated, and this was brought into the limelight in 2014 with

articles.author-name: Lizzie Greene of Mishka Vintage, Hornsey, London
articles.title: Collecting Vintage Fashion
articles.body-snippet:
It was once remarked to me that only the rich could afford to dress down intentionally.

Intended as a put down to my we
articles.body-intro:
It was once remarked to me that only the rich could afford to dress down intentionally.

Intended as a put down to my wearing old clothes she imagined as a conceit. I wondered how rich exactly I had to be before I could pull off this sartorial double negative. Without an answer I realised that the answer would be more mysterious than monetary.
So how do you qualify for this right to wear vintage?

![Wearing vintage clothes](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/vintagefashion/4.png "Wearing vintage clothes")
Given the popularity of wearing vintage clothes now across the board, it seems that so

articles.title: A Guide to Buying Fossils
articles.body-snippet: I have been selling and trading in fossils online for over 17 years. In fact my online store was the first in the UK to
articles.body-intro:
I have been selling and trading in fossils online for over 17 years. In fact my online store was the first in the UK to offer fossils for sale way back in the infancy of the .com boom in the mid-90?s. Therefore I was ideally positioned to write this guide for Rareburg.com. 

![Fossils](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/buyingfossils/Fossil_1.jpg) Buying fossils is very much like buying any other product: there are pit falls, there are ?fakes?, but on the plus side there some absolutely stunning items out there that would not look out of place in a museum, office, home interior or as part o

articles.title: Why I Collect Toys
articles.body-snippet: As a collector of 70's and 80's toys I am often asked why and how I got into collecting. Growing up I always really love
articles.body-intro:
As a collector of 70's and 80's toys I am often asked why and how I got into collecting. Growing up I always really loved my toys and always looked forward to getting new ones, even though I didn't get them that often. I have strong memories of saving up my pocket money and going on a trip to the local Tesco's to pick up a new Star Wars figure or Advanced Dungeons and Dragons (AD&D) toy. 

![Argos pages of toys I wanted](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/toycollector/argos.jpg "Argos pages of toys I wanted")
Often I would not get all the toys I wanted as my parents just couldn't afford it.

articles.title: Gashapon - Plastic Balls of Joy
articles.body-snippet: If you are visiting Japan you will inevitably see Gashapon (or Gachapon) machines lined up outside shops, in doorways, a
articles.body-intro:
If you are visiting Japan you will inevitably see Gashapon (or Gachapon) machines lined up outside shops, in doorways, actually you are probably standing next to one right now!

You may have seen these small machines outside toy shops and in cinema foyers in the UK for a few years now and thought of them as just something for kids to spend their pocket money on. But you would be wrong. In Japan they are much more than just toys for kids, people of all ages buy and collect Gashapon. 

![Gashapon Dispenser Machines](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/gashapon/gashapon1.jpg "Gashapon Dispenser

articles.title: 5 Money-Spinning Motors
articles.body-snippet: Sniffing out future classics is an inexact science. Limited availability, pedigree and history can provide guidance but
articles.body-intro:
Sniffing out future classics is an inexact science. Limited availability, pedigree and history can provide guidance but my nose for a bargain has scented five cars that could bring rich rewards in years to come. They might surprise, enrage and inspire you in equal measure, but could return a healthy profit to the bold investor. 

### Golf GTI Mk 2

![Golf GTI Mk 2](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/moneycars/golf.png "Golf GTI Mk 2")
Any self-respecting petrol-head knows the huge popularity of classic VAG (Volkswagen/Audi Group) cars. They are ubiquitous at classic meetings and the passion

articles.title: My Passion for Prints
articles.body-snippet: I have a passion for prints ? not just any framed print but portraits dating to the mid 20th century which could be foun
articles.body-intro:
I have a passion for prints ? not just any framed print but portraits dating to the mid 20th century which could be found displayed on every living room wall back in the 1950s through to the 1970s. Tretchikoff, Shabner and Lynch are among my favourite artists although I am also drawn (pardon the pun) to pictures by unknown artists that have captured the essence of the era through their art. 

![Passion for prints](https://s3.amazonaws.com/junkey/00article/prints/image2-small.jpg "Passion for prints") Over 10 years ago when I first started collecting vintage prints I could acquire them for as l

articles.title: Wearable Vintage Fashion
articles.body-snippet: Retro fashions are everywhere at the moment. In fact, for the past few years the high street chains have been full of cl
articles.body-intro:
Retro fashions are everywhere at the moment. In fact, for the past few years the high street chains have been full of clothes inspired by twentieth century designs. But some people like to go one better than buying modern versions of these blasts from the past; for them, nothing beats wearing the real thing. My daughter is one such, with a wardrobe full of gorgeous vintage dresses suitable for most occasions. 

![Fifties black lace cocktail dress](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/vintagefashion/6s.jpg "Fifties black lace cocktail dress")
It began several years ago when Amy was looking for

articles.title: The Strength of American Muscle
articles.body-snippet: Driven by nostalgia and the enduring sound of a throaty V8, classic U.S. muscle cars retain special place in the hearts
articles.body-intro:
Driven by nostalgia and the enduring sound of a throaty V8, classic U.S. muscle cars retain special place in the hearts of petrol-heads across the world.

![Chevrolet Corvette 1973](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/musclecars/Chevrolet_Corvette_1973.jpg "Chevrolet Corvette 1973")The drag racers of 50s America led the way. Manufacturers followed the smell of gasoline and developed muscle cars as cost efficient ways for blue collar youngsters to have fun without the cost of modification.

They proved so popular that hundreds of thousands of units were made but oil shortages and emission sta

articles.title: Corkscrews: An Introduction
articles.body-snippet: In just about every house in the western world you will find at least one corkscrew. In just a few, you will find nearer
articles.body-intro:
In just about every house in the western world you will find at least one corkscrew. In just a few, you will find nearer a thousand (just mine then?). Collecting antique, vintage and different corkscrews has become quite popular and as a result prices have rocketed. ![](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/corkscrew/cork1.jpg)I started to collect as a diversion from a stressful career. I chose corkscrews because I thought I could try each one out when I bought it, to assess the mechanism. This worked well until Europe put a limit on wine import into the UK and I had to cut back.
 
![](https:/

articles.title: My Top Ten Collectable Teddy Bears
articles.body-snippet: I?ve been a teddy bear enthusiast, aka an arctophile, for more than 25 years, having developed an interest in them when
articles.body-intro: I?ve been a teddy bear enthusiast, aka an arctophile, for more than 25 years, having developed an interest in them when I started dealing in antiques in the late Eighties. There?s something about the way an old bear slumps as his stuffing relaxes that I find immensely appealing and I know I am not alone. Almost since the first teddies appeared in the early ![A sleuth of teddy bears](https://assets.rareburg.com/00article/toptenbears/Bears.jpg "A sleuth of teddy bears") 1900s, people have been quietly nurturing a fondness for them but it?s only in the last 30 years or so that the hobby has gone

articles.title: On Becoming a Vinyl Aficionado
articles.body-snippet:
Let me begin by making the assumption you are reading this article because 

* you are already an avid collector of musi
articles.body-intro:
Let me begin by making the assumption you are reading this article because 

* you are already an avid collector of music on vinyl and are curious about what might be made available on this Rareburg website.
* you are a serial collector/investor interested in what potential vinyl has for a profitable way of using your funds.
* you are considering starting a vinyl collection and would like to know more about how to take your first steps towards becoming a ?vinyl junkie?.

This first article is directed primarily towards the last group, the so called ?vinyl virgins?.

In a time when we hear of m

articles.title: The ABCs of Stamp Collecting (or how I became addicted to bits of paper that somebody used to lick)
articles.body-snippet: When I was a small boy, about the age of eight, my parents gave me a ?Stamp Collecting Starter Kit? as a Christmas gift.
articles.body-intro: When I was a small boy, about the age of eight, my parents gave me a ?Stamp Collecting Starter Kit? as a Christmas gift.  I?m not saying it was love at first sight because I had already fallen in love with these small pieces of paper that some used to lick and my parents had obviously noted it.  That said, the Starter Kit made my collecting more focused and organized, and provided me with some essential information and tools that made my collecting easier. I?ve been on that road for about 30 years and if all goes well, I?ll be enjoying this marvellous hobby for the next 30-40 years as well.  S

articles.body-snippet: When I was a small boy, about the age of eight, my parents gave me a ?Stamp Collecting Starter Kit? as a Christmas gift.
articles.body-intro: When I was a small boy, about the age of eight, my parents gave me a ?Stamp Collecting Starter Kit? as a Christmas gift.  I?m not saying it was love at first sight because I had already fallen in love with these small pieces of paper that some used to lick and my parents had obviously noted it.  That said, the Starter Kit made my collecting more focused and organized, and provided me with some essential information and tools that made my collecting easier. I?ve been on that road for about 30 years and if all goes well, I?ll be enjoying this marvellous hobby for the next 30-40 years as well.  S

articles.title: A Beginner's Guide to The Flash
articles.body-snippet: One hot summer?s day in 1964 an older friend of mine met me on a playing field and handed me something I had never seen
articles.body-intro: One hot summer?s day in 1964 an older friend of mine met me on a playing field and handed me something I had never seen before, an American comic ![The Flash No.131](https://assets.rareburg.com/0000/img/article/guidetoflash/Flash_131.jpg "The Flash No.131") book. It was coverless and looked very old but I can still remember the bright, vivid colours as two characters, one in red and the other in a green and black costume were held in the hands of a large stone creature that had come to life. What I had in my hands was a copy of The Flash #131 (Near Mint - $350) from September 1962 that feature

articles.title: Obsolete Pistols and Longarms
articles.body-snippet: These weapons comprise the cartridge guns, both pistols and long arms, that the UK government have deemed obsolete for l
articles.body-intro:
These weapons comprise the cartridge guns, both pistols and long arms, that the UK government have deemed obsolete for licensing purposes under Section 58/2 of the current Firearms Act.  The Home Office has a list of the cartridges in question on their website.

The longarms consist of rifles like the .45 Martini Henry, the model 71/84 Mauser and many other European and American arms that saw service in the last half of the 19th century.  However, it should be noted that the British .303, US 30/06, German Mauser 98, Lebel 1888 and some other WWI and later European rifles are still licensed fir

articles.title: Star Wars mystery solved by an X-ray scanner
articles.body-snippet: About five years ago on a whim I purchased a unopened Star Wars mail away figure from Ebay for �5. Back in the 80?s when
articles.body-intro: About five years ago on a whim I purchased a unopened Star Wars mail away figure from Ebay for �5. Back in the 80?s when Star Wars was at its height, children could collect tokens from the back of the action figure cards and send them in to Kenner with a small amount of money, and in return they would receive a new Star Wars figure. Five figures were available via this method, ![Unopened box](https://assets.rareburg.com/0000/img/article/xraystarwars/Mail_away_box.jpg) but there is always the odd chance that a figure in an unopened white mail away box could be an un-produced item or a rare prot

articles.title: Masks, Costumes Props and Accessories
articles.body-snippet: Hi my name is Phil Page and I am the owner of PPFX a company that designs, manufactures and distributes handmade silicon
articles.body-intro:
Hi my name is Phil Page and I am the owner of PPFX a company that designs, manufactures and distributes handmade silicone masks in the UK.  Collecting is fundamentally how I started in the world of masks and costumes.  I bought my first mask at the age of 10 after seeing a family member with an old man mask they got from Blackpool. Since then I have owned over 2000 masks.

![](https://assets.rareburg.com/0000/img/article/masks/Masks_4.png)Masks, costumes, props and accessories is an easy and inexpensive hobby to get into but be warned, once you start it?s very addictive!  Most people start wit

articles.title: Collecting Movie Posters
articles.body-snippet: If you like art that is big, bold, colourful and fun, if you like art with strong design and great illustration, that en
articles.body-intro:
If you like art that is big, bold, colourful and fun, if you like art with strong design and great illustration, that engages the imagination, then you will find there are few forms of art that make the same impact as an original vintage movie poster.
 
![Fritz Lang?s Metropolis](https://assets.rareburg.com/0000/img/article/collecting-movie-posters/metropolis_german.jpg)With average prices on desirable film titles having consistently risen over many years, and with the scarcer and more sought-after posters rising to even new heights (for example US$690,000 was paid for a poster of Fritz Lang?s

articles.title: World's Finest - the team of Superman and Batman
articles.body-snippet: I am a great fan of super-hero team-up stories. My comic collecting started in 1963 and, not surprisingly, given their p
articles.body-intro: I am a great fan of super-hero team-up stories. My comic collecting started in 1963 and, not surprisingly, given their popularity then ? as now ? two of my favourite characters were Batman and Superman. As much as I enjoyed reading their separate adventures in their own titles the highlight of my visit to the local newsagent, the only one that sold comics in my part of Oxford, was to see a copy of World?s Finest Comics in the white metal revolving stand that displayed all the latest monthly titles. World?s Finest Comics teamed Batman and Superman together in the same comic and was a must have

articles.title: Little Paris
articles.body-snippet: **The story starts in 2009 with Helene Vaillant. After working for many years in creative fields in France, she decided
articles.body-intro:
**The story starts in 2009 with Helene Vaillant. After working for many years in creative fields in France, she decided to open Little Paris in London to fulfil her passion for antiques and French home and fashion accessories. Her idea was to create an innovative, unique and homely place which embodied the spirit of the France she knows and loves, a little vault of wonders in North London where people would come to be surprised, amused and most of all have a good time in a French vintage decor.**

![](https://assets.rareburg.com/0000/img/article/Little_Paris_1.jpg)Little Paris offers a fascina

articles.title: How I Got Started Collecting Antique Golf Clubs
articles.body-snippet: I bought my first wood shaft golf club at the Bermondsey Antiques market in the early 80s. Getting information in those
articles.body-intro: I bought my first wood shaft golf club at the Bermondsey Antiques market in the early 80s. Getting information in those days was not as easy as it is now. We did not have the Internet or Google. So it was off to my local library. I had heard of a book that had been written on golf clubs and the history of golf called ?Golf in the Making?. It was a fairly expensive book at �30.00 so I got the library to order one in. When I got a look at it I was absolutely fascinated, so much so that I had to have a copy of my own. This turned out to be one of the best decisions I have ever made: there was so

articles.title: Arms, Armour and Militaria
articles.body-snippet: **This is a vast subject, starting in the classical age of Greece and Rome c 800 BC for the West and encompassing the Ch
articles.body-intro:
**This is a vast subject, starting in the classical age of Greece and Rome c 800 BC for the West and encompassing the Chinese Bronze Age c 700 BC in the East. Here is an overview of antique militaria.**
 
Bronze Age equipment is increasingly hard to source in good condition and with adequate provenance.  There are specialist auctions held, mainly in London, but also in New York and Europe.  There is also the growing problem of modern fakes in this area.  Starting prices are around �500/1,000 for Roman and Chinese spearheads, rather more for Roman and Greek swords, and in the tens of thousands

articles.title: Beating The Averages
articles.body-snippet: In the summer of 1995, my friend Robert Morris and I started a startup called Viaweb. Our plan was to write software tha
articles.body-intro:
In the summer of 1995, my friend Robert Morris and I started a startup called Viaweb. Our plan was to write software that would let end users build online stores. What was novel about this software, at the time, was that it ran on our server, using ordinary Web pages as the interface.

A lot of people could have been having this idea at the same time, of course, but as far as I know, Viaweb was the first Web-based application. It seemed such a novel idea to us that we named the company after it: Viaweb, because our software worked via the Web, instead of running on your desktop computer.

Anot

articles.title: DO ANDROIDS DREAM OF ELECTRIC SHEEP?
articles.body-snippet: A merry little surge of electricity piped by automatic alarm from the mood organ beside his bed awakened Rick Deckard. S
articles.body-intro:
A merry little surge of electricity piped by automatic alarm from the mood organ beside his bed awakened Rick Deckard. Surprised - it always surprised him to find himself awake without prior notice - he rose from the bed, stood up in his multicolored pajamas, and stretched. Now, in her bed, his wife Iran opened her gray, unmerry eyes, blinked, then groaned and shut her eyes again.

"You set your Penfield too weak" he said to her. "I'll reset it and you'll be awake and - "

"Keep your hand off my settings." Her voice held bitter sharpness. "I don't want to be awake."

He seated himself beside h

articles.title: Never Talk with Strangers
articles.body-snippet: At the hour of the hot spring sunset two citizens appeared at the Patriarch?s Ponds. One of them, approximately forty ye
articles.body-intro: At the hour of the hot spring sunset two citizens appeared at the Patriarch?s Ponds. One of them, approximately forty years old, dressed in a grey summer suit, was short, dark-haired, plump, bald, and carried his respectable fedora hat in his hand. His neatly shaven face was adorned with black horn-rimmed glasses of a supernatural size. The other, a broad-shouldered young man with tousled reddish hair, his checkered cap cocked back on his head, was wearing a cowboy shirt, wrinkled white trousers and black sneakers. The first was none other than Mikhail Alexandrovich Berlioz, editor of a fat li

articles.title: Comic Books and The Influences of Film & TV Adaptations
articles.body-snippet: As an old time comic collector, starting from when I was just eight years old back in 1969 (wow, time certainly flies pa
articles.body-intro:
As an old time comic collector, starting from when I was just eight years old back in 1969 (wow, time certainly flies past!) I find the whole comic book universe at the moment to be extremely exciting as if something fast & powerful has rolled into Dodge and at the moment there does not appear to be anything to stop it. I?m talking about the influence of Films & T.V. on the comic book marketplace.
 
![](https://assets.rareburg.com/0000/img/article/comic_Amazing_Spider-Man.jpg) Both these media have had an unbelievable effect on many different comic book values, which have soared skywards very

articles.title: Automobilia - Rome Wasn't Built in a Day
articles.body-snippet: Two years ago I was contacted by a client regarding an item for sale on our website. Nothing unusual about that you migh
articles.body-intro:
Two years ago I was contacted by a client regarding an item for sale on our website. Nothing unusual about that you might think, but as we chatted away I became more and more intrigued at what he was telling me about his collection or, more to the point, the building housing his collection and the work required to build it. It was one of those phone calls where you know a visit is required to satisfy your curiosity. 
 
![](https://assets.rareburg.com/0000/img/article/rome_075.jpg) This guy lived on the outskirts of Sheffield and I quickly agreed to deliver the items he had just purchased on my

articles.title: Classic Cars
articles.body-snippet: Classic cars have been one of the best performing investments of the last decade with an average return of 456%, accordi
articles.body-intro:
Classic cars have been one of the best performing investments of the last decade with an average return of 456%, according to the Historic Automobile Group Index (HAGI).

Though these statistics are skewed by multi-million pound, high-end sales, they point to a vibrant market in collector cars. There are obvious pitfalls, such as tying your money up for at least 5 years with no guaranteed return and the inevitable maintenance and repair costs, but collectible vehicles can return a profit.

The question is, how?

The right research can offer guidance. Like a TED (?Ideas Worth Spreading?) talk f

articles.title: Automobilia - Early Days
articles.body-snippet: My first memory of any sort of attraction to Automobilia was in the early Sixties when the local land owner and owner of
articles.body-intro:
My first memory of any sort of attraction to Automobilia was in the early Sixties when the local land owner and owner of the quarry, which sat in the middle of our Derbyshire village, purchased an Aston Martin DB.  In our village of very few motor vehicles it was quite a sight to witness the sleek lines and audible growl of this ?Bond? car cruising through our sleepy lanes.
 
![](https://assets.rareburg.com/0000/img/article/Aston_Martin_DB4.jpg)I remember all the school children running along the road to gaze at this super car as its millionaire owner manoeuvred it into its parking space outsi

articles.title: Arms, Armour and Militaria
articles.body-snippet: **This is a vast subject, starting in the classical age of Greece and Rome c 800 BC for the West and encompassing the Ch
articles.body-intro:
**This is a vast subject, starting in the classical age of Greece and Rome c 800 BC for the West and encompassing the Chinese Bronze Age c 700 BC in the East. Here is an overview of antique militaria.**
 
Bronze Age equipment is increasingly hard to source in good condition and with adequate provenance.  There are specialist auctions held, mainly in London, but also in New York and Europe.  There is also the growing problem of modern fakes in this area.  Starting prices are around �500/1,000 for Roman and Chinese spearheads, rather more for Roman and Greek swords, and in the tens of thousands
